text.title: A Hybrid Data Hiding Method for Strict AMBTC Format Images with High-Fidelity

p.s: Two important techniques are used in our proposed method : absolute moment block truncation coding ( AMBTC ) compression and matrix coding .
These techniques are briefly introduced in Section 2.1 and Section 2.2 , respectively .

head.s: Absolute Moment Block Truncation Coding ( AMBTC )

p.s: In 1979 , an efficient block-based lossy image compression technique named block truncation coding ( BTC ) was proposed by Delp and Mitchell .
In order to achieve compression , an image is divided into several non-overlapping blocks and stores only one bitmap and two corresponding quantization values of each block .
Because the algorithm utilized in the BTC technique has significant computational complexity , Lema and Mitchell proposed an improved version named absolute moment block truncation coding ( AMBTC ) .
